items.sentence: Tom has spent a lot of money on jewelry for Mary.
I can't believe how much happier Tom looks today.
Who told you that I was going to the beach today?
What are you planning on doing after the concert?
If Tom doesn't receive treatment soon, he'll die.
You're the one who sold those to Tom, aren't you?
I suspect Tom isn't planning to be here tomorrow.
You're not really going to vote for Tom, are you?
I don't want to be any more burden to my parents.
I forgot to put on sunscreen, so I got sunburned.
French is the only foreign language I've studied.
Judging from the sky, I think it's going to snow.
Please give this package to Tom when you see him.
Tom is open to people who see things differently.
Tom asked Mary if she really meant what she said.
We've finally managed to persuade Tom to help us.
I know about how much time it'll take to do that.
I stayed in bed all day instead of going to work.
I spent all yesterday afternoon cleaning my room.
I like lots of butter on my toast in the morning.
